@dev Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where
 there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to
 specific functions.
 The initial owner is set to the address provided by the deployer. This can
 later be changed with {transferOwnership}.
 This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier
 `onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to
 the owner.
@dev The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.
@dev The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)
@dev Initializes the contract setting the address provided by the deployer as the initial owner.
@dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
@dev Returns the address of the current owner.
@dev Throws if the sender is not the owner.

@dev Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call
 `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner.
 NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner,
 thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

@dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
 Can only be called by the current owner.

@dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
 Internal function without access restriction.

@dev Provides information about the current execution context, including the
 sender of the transaction and its data. While these are generally available
 via msg.sender and msg.data, they should not be accessed in such a direct
 manner, since when dealing with meta-transactions the account sending and
 paying for execution may not be the actual sender (as far as an application
 is concerned).
 This contract is only required for intermediate, library-like contracts.

@dev Contract module that helps prevent reentrant calls to a function.
 Inheriting from `ReentrancyGuard` will make the {nonReentrant} modifier
 available, which can be applied to functions to make sure there are no nested
 (reentrant) calls to them.
 Note that because there is a single `nonReentrant` guard, functions marked as
 `nonReentrant` may not call one another. This can be worked around by making
 those functions `private`, and then adding `external` `nonReentrant` entry
 points to them.
 TIP: If EIP-1153 (transient storage) is available on the chain you're deploying at,
 consider using {ReentrancyGuardTransient} instead.
 TIP: If you would like to learn more about reentrancy and alternative ways
 to protect against it, check out our blog post
 https://blog.openzeppelin.com/reentrancy-after-istanbul/[Reentrancy After Istanbul].
@dev Unauthorized reentrant call.

@dev Prevents a contract from calling itself, directly or indirectly.
 Calling a `nonReentrant` function from another `nonReentrant`
 function is not supported. It is possible to prevent this from happening
 by making the `nonReentrant` function external, and making it call a
 `private` function that does the actual work.

@dev Returns true if the reentrancy guard is currently set to "entered", which indicates there is a
 `nonReentrant` function in the call stack.

@title GameFactory
 @dev Factory contract for deploying and managing TwoThirdsAverageGame instances
 
 PURPOSE:
 - Allows anyone to create new 2/3 average games with standard settings
 - Maintains registry of all deployed games
 - Provides "current game" pointer for frontend convenience
 - Ensures all service fees flow to the factory owner
 
 BUSINESS MODEL:
 - Players can create games for free using default parameters
 - Factory owner earns service fee from all games (usually 5%)
 - Owner can customize default parameters for new games
 
 ARCHITECTURE:
 - Each game is an independent TwoThirdsAverageGame contract
 - Factory maintains ownership of all created games so service fees flow back
 - Uses CREATE (via `new`) to deploy games; can be extended to CREATE2 for deterministic addresses
 - Registry of deployed games is stored on-chain for enumeration and lookups
@dev Constructor sets the deployer as the factory owner.
@notice Array of all deployed TwoThirdsAverageGame contract addresses
@notice Mapping to quickly verify whether an address was created by this factory
@notice Currently featured or active game for frontend convenience
@notice Default entry fee for each player, expressed in wei (e.g. 0.01 ether)
@notice Emitted when a new game is created (address and index in `games` array)
@notice Emitted when `currentGame` is set or changed
@notice Emitted when default parameters are updated by the owner

@dev Deploy a TwoThirdsAverageGame with factory default parameters. Anyone may call.
 @return Address of the newly deployed TwoThirdsAverageGame contract
 This uses the factory’s default configuration:
   - defaultMinPlayers
   - defaultMaxPlayers
   - defaultCommitDuration
   - defaultRevealDuration
   - defaultEntryFee
   - defaultServiceFeePercent
   - defaultAutoStartDelay
 Process:
 1. Deploy child game with default parameters
 2. Register it in the registry (`games` array + `gameExists` mapping)
 3. Transfer ownership of the child to factory owner (so fees flow correctly)
 4. If first game, set `currentGame`
 5. Emit `GameCreated`

@dev Returns the total number of games deployed by this factory.
 @return Number of games in the `games` array.

@title TwoThirdsAverageGame
 @dev Implementation of the classic 2/3 Average Game on blockchain, optimized for gas.
 GAME THEORY:
 - Each player privately chooses a number in the range [0, 1000].
 - Once all players reveal, compute the average of all revealed numbers (integer division).
 - The target is 2/3 of that average (again truncated to an integer).
 - The winner is the player whose guess is closest to the 2/3‐average. In case of a tie,
   a pseudo‐random tie‐breaker (using block.timestamp and block.prevrandao) selects one.
 GAME FLOW:
 1. WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS: Players join by paying the entry fee. Minimum and maximum player counts enforced.
 2. GAME_STARTING: Once minPlayers is reached, a grace period (autoStartDelay) begins to allow last‐minute joins.
 3. COMMIT_PHASE: Players submit a hash of (guess || salt) to commit their guess without revealing it.
 4. REVEAL_PHASE: Players reveal their original guess and salt, which must match the earlier commitment.
 5. EVALUATING_RESULTS: Once reveal window closes, anyone can call finalizeGame() to compute the winner.
 6. GAME_ENDED: Winner and service‐fee recipient can withdraw their ETH; no further game actions allowed.
 SECURITY:
 - Commit‐reveal prevents front‐running of guesses.
 - ReentrancyGuard + pull‐over‐push withdrawal pattern prevent reentrancy/DoS attacks.
 - Ownable grants administrative control (e.g., in a zero‐reveal scenario, owner takes the pot).
 GAS OPTIMIZATIONS:
 - Uses _runningSum and _runningCount to accumulate revealed guesses, avoiding an O(n) loop just to sum.
 - Caches playerAddresses.length before loops in finalizeGame() to avoid repeated SLOADs.
 - Packs Player struct tightly so it consumes only two storage slots.
 - O(1) removal pattern in leaveGame() to refund pre‐game leavers.
@notice Minimum number of players required to start the game (must be ≥ 3)
@notice Maximum number of players allowed in a single game
@notice Duration (in seconds) of the commit phase (players submit hashed guesses)
@notice Duration (in seconds) of the reveal phase (players reveal their guesses)
@notice Entry fee each player must pay to join
@notice Platform service fee percentage (must be ≤ 20). Winner receives (100 - serviceFeePercent)% of pot.
@notice Delay (in seconds) after minPlayers reached before commit phase begins (grace period)
@dev Enumeration of the various phases of the game.
@notice Current phase of the game; updated as time advances and actions occur
@notice Timestamp (in seconds since epoch) when minPlayers was first reached (used to schedule phases)
@notice Mapping from player address to their Player struct
@notice Array of all player addresses who have joined (for enumeration)
@notice Mapping to track each player's index in playerAddresses[] for O(1) removal
@dev Running sum of all revealed guesses (to avoid a separate summation loop)
@dev Running count of total reveals (to compute average on the fly)
@notice Final integer average of all revealed guesses (sum / count)
@notice Final 2/3‐average computed as floor((average * 2) / 3)
@notice Address of the winner (closest guess to twoThirdsAverage)
@notice Total ETH in the prize pool (accumulates entry fees)
@notice Mapping of addresses to their withdrawable ETH balances
@notice Emitted whenever a player successfully joins and pays the entry fee
@notice Emitted when a player submits their commitment (hash of guess||salt)
@notice Emitted when a player reveals their guess successfully
@notice Emitted whenever a withdrawal is made (for refunds or prize/service fees)

@dev Allows a player to join the game by paying the exact `entryFee`.
      Must be called while in WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS or within the grace period in GAME_STARTING.
      Once `minPlayers` is reached for the first time, the `minPlayersReachedTime` is set
      and the phase transitions to GAME_STARTING. After `autoStartDelay` passes, commit phase begins.
 Requirements:
 - Current phase (via getPhase()) must be WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS or GAME_STARTING (and within `autoStartDelay`).
 - Total joined players (`playerAddresses.length`) must be < `maxPlayers`.
 - Caller must not have already joined.
 - msg.value must exactly equal `entryFee`.
 Effects:
 - Records the new player in `players[msg.sender]`.
 - Adds address to `playerAddresses` & `playerIndex`.
 - Increases `prizePool` by `msg.value`.
 - Emits {PlayerJoined}.
 - If this join triggers `minPlayers` for the first time, sets `minPlayersReachedTime`,
   transitions to GAME_STARTING, and emits {GameStarting}.

@dev Players submit their commitment (hash of guess || salt) during the COMMIT_PHASE.
 Requirements:
 - Current phase (via getPhase()) must be COMMIT_PHASE.
 - Caller must have joined (players[msg.sender].hasJoined == true).
 - Caller must not have already committed (players[msg.sender].hasCommitted == false).
 Effects:
 - Stores `hash` in `players[msg.sender].commitment`.
 - Marks `players[msg.sender].hasCommitted = true`.
 - Emits {GuessCommitted}.

@dev Players reveal their guess and salt during the REVEAL_PHASE.
      Must match the previously submitted commitment: keccak256(abi.encodePacked(guess, salt)).
      Updates `_runningSum` and `_runningCount` so that finalizeGame() can compute averages in O(1).
 Requirements:
 - Current phase must be REVEAL_PHASE.
 - Caller must have joined and already committed.
 - Caller must not have already revealed.
 - keccak256(abi.encodePacked(guess, salt)) must equal `players[msg.sender].commitment`.
 Effects:
 - Stores `uint16(guess)` in `players[msg.sender].revealedGuess`.
 - Marks `players[msg.sender].hasRevealed = true`.
 - Increments `_runningSum` by `guess` and `_runningCount` by 1.
 - Emits {GuessRevealed}.
 @param guess The original guess (0 ≤ guess ≤ 1000).
 @param salt  The secret salt used during commitment.

@dev Finalizes the game after REVEAL_PHASE ends. Anyone can call.
      Computes the integer average of all revealed guesses, then 2/3 of that average.
      Finds the player(s) whose guess is closest to that target. If multiple players tie,
      selects one via a pseudo‐random tie‐breaker. Distributes prize minus service fee.
 Requirements:
 - Current phase (via getPhase()) must be EVALUATING_RESULTS.
 Effects:
 - If `_runningCount == 0` (no one revealed):
     • Owner takes all ETH in `prizePool`.
     • Sets `winner = owner()`, `average = 0`, `twoThirdsAverage = 0`.
     • Marks `currentPhase = GAME_ENDED`, emits {GameEnded}.
 - Else:
     • Computes `avg = uint16(_runningSum / _runningCount)`.
     • Computes `two3 = uint16((avg * 2) / 3)`.
     • Iterates over `playerAddresses` (cached length in local `n`) to find the minimum absolute difference
       between each `p.revealedGuess` and `two3`. Builds a memory array `tied[]` of all players who achieve
       the same bestDiff. Uses `keccak256(abi.encodePacked(block.timestamp, block.prevrandao, tieCount))`
       modulo `tieCount` to select one winner if there is a tie.
     • Calculates `serviceFee = (prizePool * serviceFeePercent) / 100`.
     • Winner gets `prizePool - serviceFee`, owner gets `serviceFee`, stored in `pendingWithdrawals`.
     • Updates `average`, `twoThirdsAverage`, `winner`, `currentPhase = GAME_ENDED`.
     • Emits {GameEnded}.

@dev Pull‐over‐push withdrawal pattern. Anyone with a nonzero pending withdrawal balance
      can call this to receive their ETH (refunds, winnings, or service fee).
 Requirements:
 - pendingWithdrawals[msg.sender] must be > 0.
 Effects:
 - Captures `amt = pendingWithdrawals[msg.sender]`, sets it to 0, and transfers `amt` to msg.sender.
 - Emits {Withdrawal}.

@dev Allows a player to leave the game before it officially starts (only in WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS).
      Player is fully refunded the entry fee via pendingWithdrawals.
      Uses O(1) removal from the playerAddresses array by swapping with the last element.
 Requirements:
 - Current phase (via getPhase()) must be WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS.
 - Caller must have joined (players[msg.sender].hasJoined == true).
 Effects:
 - Removes the player’s address from playerAddresses (swap & pop).
 - Refunds entryFee by adding to pendingWithdrawals[msg.sender].
 - Decrements prizePool by entryFee.
 - Deletes players[msg.sender] to clear storage and receive gas refund.
 - Emits {Withdrawal} with the refunded amount.

@dev Returns the number of seconds remaining in the current phase (commit or reveal).
      If below `minPlayers` or past reveal window, returns 0.
 Calculation:
   start         = minPlayersReachedTime
   commitStart   = start + autoStartDelay
   commitEnd     = commitStart + commitDuration
   revealEnd     = commitEnd + revealDuration
   If now < commitStart: sec = commitStart - now
   Else if now < commitEnd: sec = commitEnd - now
   Else if now < revealEnd: sec = revealEnd - now
   Else: sec = 0
 @return Number of seconds remaining in the current commit or reveal window.

@dev Computes the current `GamePhase` based on timestamps and internal state.
      This function does not modify state (view).
 Logic:
   If currentPhase == GAME_ENDED → return GAME_ENDED.
   If playerAddresses.length < minPlayers → return WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS.
   Otherwise:
     commitStart = minPlayersReachedTime + autoStartDelay
     commitEnd   = commitStart + commitDuration
     revealEnd   = commitEnd + revealDuration
     If now < commitStart → GAME_STARTING
     Else If now < commitEnd → COMMIT_PHASE
     Else If now < revealEnd → REVEAL_PHASE
     Else → EVALUATING_RESULTS
 @return The current phase of the game.

@dev Returns the number of players who have joined.
 @return Length of the `playerAddresses` array.

@dev Returns the full list of addresses that have joined.
 @return Array of player addresses.

@dev Struct for returning game results off-chain.
      Contains computed averages, winner address, winner’s prize, and service fee.

@dev Computes game results off‐chain (view only, no state changes).
      WARNING: Loops over all players in memory; use only off-chain or in non-gas‐sensitive contexts.
 Steps (mirrors finalizeGame logic):
   1. Sum all revealed guesses and count them.
   2. If count == 0 → winner = owner, prize = prizePool, serviceFee = 0, average = twoThirds = 0.
   3. Else compute avg = uint16(sum / count), two3 = uint16((avg * 2) / 3).
   4. Identify all players whose revealedGuess differs from two3 by the minimal amount, collect them in `tied[]`.
   5. If tieCountLocal == 1 → that player is winner. Else → pseudo‐random tiebreaker among `tied[]`.
   6. Compute serviceFee = (prizePool * serviceFeePercent) / 100, winCut = prizePool - serviceFee.
 @return r A Results struct with fields:
   - average: integer average of revealed guesses
   - twoThirdsAverage: computed target
   - winner: address of chosen winner
   - prize: winner’s net amount (prizePool - serviceFee)
   - serviceFee: owner’s cut

contract for deploying and managing TwoThirdsAverageGame instances  PURPOSE: - Allows anyone to create new 2/3 average games with standard settings - Maintains registry of all deployed games - Provides \"current game\" pointer for frontend convenience - Ensures all service fees flow to the factory owner  BUSINESS MODEL: - Players can create games for free using default parameters - Factory owner earns service fee from all games (usually 5%) - Owner can customize default parameters for new games  ARCHITECTURE: - Each game is an independent TwoThirdsAverageGame contract - Factory maintains ownership of all created games so service fees flow back - Uses CREATE (via `new`) to deploy games; can be extended to CREATE2 for deterministic addresses - Registry of deployed games is stored on-chain for enumeration and lookups","errors":{"OwnableInvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)"}],"OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address)":[{"details":"The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation."}]},"kind":"dev","methods":{"constructor":{"details":"Constructor sets the deployer as the factory owner."},"createCustomGame(uint16,uint16,uint32,uint32,uint256,uint8,uint32)":{"details":"Deploy a TwoThirdsAverageGame with custom parameters. Only the factory owner may call.","params":{"_autoStartDelay":"Delay (seconds) after minPlayers reached before commit phase starts (must be > 0)","_commitDuration":"Length of commit phase in seconds (must be > 0)","_entryFee":"Entry fee (wei) for each player to join","_maxPlayers":"Maximum players allowed (must be > _minPlayers)","_minPlayers":"Minimum players required to start (must be \u2265 3)","_revealDuration":"Length of reveal phase in seconds (must be > 0)","_serviceFeePercent":"Platform service fee percentage (must be \u2264 20)"},"returns":{"_0":"Address of the newly deployed TwoThirdsAverageGame contract Implements: 1. Parameter validation (revert if inputs invalid) 2. Child contract deployment via `new TwoThirdsAverageGame(...)` 3. Registry insertion (`games.push(...)` and `gameExists[...] = true`) 4. Transfer of ownership of the child game to the factory owner 5. Setting `currentGame` if this is the very first game deployed"}},"createGame()":{"details":"Deploy a TwoThirdsAverageGame with factory default parameters. Anyone may call.","returns":{"_0":"Address of the newly deployed TwoThirdsAverageGame contract This uses the factory\u2019s default configuration:   - defaultMinPlayers   - defaultMaxPlayers   - defaultCommitDuration   - defaultRevealDuration   - defaultEntryFee   - defaultServiceFeePercent   - defaultAutoStartDelay Process: 1. Deploy child game with default parameters 2. Register it in the registry (`games` array + `gameExists` mapping) 3. Transfer ownership of the child to factory owner (so fees flow correctly) 4. If first game, set `currentGame` 5. Emit `GameCreated`"}},"getAllGames()":{"details":"Returns the full array of deployed game addresses. ion"},{"inputs":[],"name":"renounceOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"revealDuration","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"guess","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"bytes32","name":"salt","type":"bytes32"}],"name":"revealGuess","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"serviceFeePercent","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"twoThirdsAverage","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint16","name":"","type":"uint16"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"winner","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"withdraw","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Implementation of the classic 2/3 Average Game on blockchain, optimized for gas. GAME THEORY: - Each player privately chooses a number in the range [0, 1000]. - Once all players reveal, compute the average of all revealed numbers (integer division). - The target is 2/3 of that average (again truncated to an integer). - The winner is the player whose guess is closest to the 2/3\u2010average. In case of a tie,   a pseudo\u2010random tie\u2010breaker (using block.timestamp and block.prevrandao) selects one. GAME FLOW: 1. WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS: Players join by paying the entry fee. Minimum and maximum player counts enforced. 2. GAME_STARTING: Once minPlayers is reached, a grace period (autoStartDelay) begins to allow last\u2010minute joins. 3. COMMIT_PHASE: Players submit a hash of (guess || salt) to commit their guess without revealing it. 4. REVEAL_PHASE: Players reveal their original guess and salt, which must match the earlier commitment. 5. EVALUATING_RESULTS: Once reveal window closes, anyone can call finalizeGame() to compute the winner. 6. GAME_ENDED: Winner and service\u2010fee recipient can withdraw their ETH; no further game actions allowed. SECURITY: - Commit\u2010reveal prevents front\u2010running of guesses. - ReentrancyGuard + pull\u2010over\u2010push withdrawal pattern prevent reentrancy/DoS attacks. - Ownable grants administrative control (e.g., in a zero\u2010reveal scenario, owner takes the pot). GAS OPTIMIZATIONS: - Uses _runningSum and _runningCount to accumulate revealed guesses, avoiding an O(n) loop just to sum. - Caches playerAddresses.length before loops in finalizeGame() to avoid repeated SLOADs. - Packs Player struct tightly so it consumes only two storage slots. - O(1) removal pattern in leaveGame() to refund pre\u2010game leavers.","errors":{"OwnableInvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)"}],"OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address)":[{"details":"The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}]},"events":{"GameEnded(uint16,uint16,address,uint256)":{"params":{"average":"Final average of revealed guesses (integer)","prize":"Net prize amount awarded to the winner (after service fee)","twoThirdsAverage":"Final two\u2010thirds average computed","winner":"Address of the winning player"}},"GameStarting(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"commitEnd":"Timestamp when the commit phase will end (commitStart + commitDuration)","commitStart":"Timestamp when the commit phase will begin (startTime + autoStartDelay)","entryFee":"The entry fee each player must pay","maxPlayers":"Maximum players allowed","minPlayers":"Minimum players required to start","startTime":"Timestamp when the minimum number of players was reached"}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"commitGuess(bytes32)":{"details":"Players submit their commitment (hash of guess || salt) during the COMMIT_PHASE. Requirements: - Current phase (via getPhase()) must be COMMIT_PHASE. - Caller must have joined (players[msg.sender].hasJoined == true). - Caller must not have already committed (players[msg.sender].hasCommitted == false). Effects: - Stores `hash` in `players[msg.sender].commitment`. - Marks `players[msg.sender].hasCommitted = true`. - Emits {GuessCommitted}."},"constructor":{"details":"Constructor initializes all game configuration parameters. Sets the initial phase to WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS.","params":{"_autoStartDelay":"Delay (in seconds) after minPlayers reached before commit begins (must be > 0)","_commitDuration":"Duration of the commit phase, in seconds (must be > 0)","_entryFee":"Entry fee (in wei) each player must pay to join","_maxPlayers":"Maximum number of players allowed (must be > _minPlayers)","_minPlayers":"Minimum number of players to begin (must be \u2265 3)","_revealDuration":"Duration of the reveal phase, in seconds (must be > 0)","_serviceFeePercent":"Platform service fee percentage (0\u201320)"}},"finalizeGame()":{"details":"Finalizes the game after REVEAL_PHASE ends. Anyone can call.      Computes the integer average of all revealed guesses, then 2/3 of that average.      Finds the player(s) whose guess is closest to that target. If multiple players tie,      selects one via a pseudo\u2010random tie\u2010breaker. Distributes prize minus service fee. Requirements: - Current phase (via getPhase()) must be EVALUATING_RESULTS. Effects: - If `_runningCount == 0` (no one revealed):     \u2022 Owner takes all ETH in `prizePool`.     \u2022 Sets `winner = owner()`, `average = 0`, `twoThirdsAverage = 0`.     \u2022 Marks `currentPhase = GAME_ENDED`, emits {GameEnded}. - Else:     \u2022 Computes `avg = uint16(_runningSum / _runningCount)`.     \u2022 Computes `two3 = uint16((avg * 2) / 3)`.     \u2022 Iterates over `playerAddresses` (cached length in local `n`) to find the minimum absolute difference       between each `p.revealedGuess` and `two3`. Builds a memory array `tied[]` of all players who achieve       the same bestDiff. Uses `keccak256(abi.encodePacked(block.timestamp, block.prevrandao, tieCount))`       modulo `tieCount` to select one winner if there is a tie.     \u2022 Calculates `serviceFee = (prizePool * serviceFeePercent) / 100`.     \u2022 Winner gets `prizePool - serviceFee`, owner gets `serviceFee`, stored in `pendingWithdrawals`.     \u2022 Updates `average`, `twoThirdsAverage`, `winner`, `currentPhase = GAME_ENDED`.     \u2022 Emits {GameEnded}."},"getPhase()":{"details":"Computes the current `GamePhase` based on timestamps and internal state.      This function does not modify state (view). Logic:   If currentPhase == GAME_ENDED \u2192 return GAME_ENDED.   If playerAddresses.length < minPlayers \u2192 return WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS.   Otherwise:     commitStart = minPlayersReachedTime + autoStartDelay     commitEnd   = commitStart + commitDuration     revealEnd   = commitEnd + revealDuration     If now < commitStart \u2192 GAME_STARTING     Else If now < commitEnd \u2192 COMMIT_PHASE     Else If now < revealEnd \u2192 REVEAL_PHASE     Else \u2192 EVALUATING_RESULTS","returns":{"_0":"The current phase of the game."}},"getPlayerCount()":{"details":"Returns the number of players who have joined.","returns":{"_0":"Length of the `playerAddresses` array."}},"getPlayers()":{"details":"Returns the full list of addresses that have joined.","returns":{"_0":"Array of player addresses."}},"getResults()":{"details":"Computes game results off\u2010chain (view only, no state changes).      WARNING: Loops over all players in memory; use only off-chain or in non-gas\u2010sensitive contexts. Steps (mirrors finalizeGame logic):   1. Sum all revealed guesses and count them.   2. If count == 0 \u2192 winner = owner, prize = prizePool, serviceFee = 0, average = twoThirds = 0.   3. Else compute avg = uint16(sum / count), two3 = uint16((avg * 2) / 3).   4. Identify all players whose revealedGuess differs from two3 by the minimal amount, collect them in `tied[]`.   5. If tieCountLocal == 1 \u2192 that player is winner. Else \u2192 pseudo\u2010random tiebreaker among `tied[]`.   6. Compute serviceFee = (prizePool * serviceFeePercent) / 100, winCut = prizePool - serviceFee.","returns":{"r":"A Results struct with fields:   - average: integer average of revealed guesses   - twoThirdsAverage: computed target   - winner: address of chosen winner   - prize: winner\u2019s net amount (prizePool - serviceFee)   - serviceFee: owner\u2019s cut"}},"getTimeRemaining()":{"details":"Returns the number of seconds remaining in the current phase (commit or reveal).      If below `minPlayers` or past reveal window, returns 0. Calculation:   start         = minPlayersReachedTime   commitStart   = start + autoStartDelay   commitEnd     = commitStart + commitDuration   revealEnd     = commitEnd + revealDuration   If now < commitStart: sec = commitStart - now   Else if now < commitEnd: sec = commitEnd - now   Else if now < revealEnd: sec = revealEnd - now   Else: sec = 0","returns":{"_0":"Number of seconds remaining in the current commit or reveal window."}},"joinGame()":{"details":"Allows a player to join the game by paying the exact `entryFee`.      Must be called while in WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS or within the grace period in GAME_STARTING.      Once `minPlayers` is reached for the first time, the `minPlayersReachedTime` is set      and the phase transitions to GAME_STARTING. After `autoStartDelay` passes, commit phase begins. Requirements: - Current phase (via getPhase()) must be WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS or GAME_STARTING (and within `autoStartDelay`). - Total joined players (`playerAddresses.length`) must be < `maxPlayers`. - Caller must not have already joined. - msg.value must exactly equal `entryFee`. Effects: - Records the new player in `players[msg.sender]`. - Adds address to `playerAddresses` & `playerIndex`. - Increases `prizePool` by `msg.value`. - Emits {PlayerJoined}. - If this join triggers `minPlayers` for the first time, sets `minPlayersReachedTime`,   transitions to GAME_STARTING, and emits {GameStarting}."},"leaveGame()":{"details":"Allows a player to leave the game before it officially starts (only in WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS).      Player is fully refunded the entry fee via pendingWithdrawals.      Uses O(1) removal from the playerAddresses array by swapping with the last element. Requirements: - Current phase (via getPhase()) must be WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS. - Caller must have joined (players[msg.sender].hasJoined == true). Effects: - Removes the player\u2019s address from playerAddresses (swap & pop). - Refunds entryFee by adding to pendingWithdrawals[msg.sender]. - Decrements prizePool by entryFee. - Deletes players[msg.sender] to clear storage and receive gas refund. - Emits {Withdrawal} with the refunded amount."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"revealGuess(uint256,bytes32)":{"details":"Players reveal their guess and salt during the REVEAL_PHASE.      Must match the previously submitted commitment: keccak256(abi.encodePacked(guess, salt)).      Updates `_runningSum` and `_runningCount` so that finalizeGame() can compute averages in O(1). Requirements: - Current phase must be REVEAL_PHASE. - Caller must have joined and already committed. - Caller must not have already revealed. - keccak256(abi.encodePacked(guess, salt)) must equal `players[msg.sender].commitment`. Effects: - Stores `uint16(guess)` in `players[msg.sender].revealedGuess`. - Marks `players[msg.sender].hasRevealed = true`. - Increments `_runningSum` by `guess` and `_runningCount` by 1. - Emits {GuessRevealed}.","params":{"guess":"The original guess (0 \u2264 guess \u2264 1000).","salt":"The secret salt used during commitment."}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"withdraw()":{"details":"Pull\u2010over\u2010push withdrawal pattern. Anyone with a nonzero pending withdrawal balance      can call this to receive their ETH (refunds, winnings, or service fee). Requirements: - pendingWithdrawals[msg.sender] must be > 0. Effects: - Captures `amt = pendingWithdrawals[msg.sender]`, sets it to 0, and transfers `amt` to msg.sender. - Emits {Withdrawal}."}},"stateVariables":{"_runningCount":{"details":"Running count of total reveals (to compute average on the fly)"},"_runningSum":{"details":"Running sum of all revealed guesses (to avoid a separate summation loop)"}},"title":"TwoThirdsAverageGame","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"GameEnded(uint16,uint16,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when the game ends and winner is determined."},"GameStarting(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when the game transitions from WAITING_FOR_PLAYERS \u2192 GAME_STARTING."},"GuessCommitted(address)":{"notice":"Emitted when a player submits their commitment (hash of guess||salt)"},"GuessRevealed(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a player reveals their guess successfully"},"PlayerJoined(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted whenever a player successfully joins and pays the entry fee"},"Withdrawal(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted whenever a withdrawal is made (for refunds or prize/service fees)"}},"kind":"user","methods":{"autoStartDelay()":{"notice":"Delay (in seconds) after minPlayers reached before commit phase begins (grace period)"},"average()":{"notice":"Final integer average of all revealed guesses (sum / count)"},"commitDuration()":{"notice":"Duration (in seconds) of the commit phase (players submit hashed guesses)"},"currentPhase()":{"notice":"Current phase of the game; updated as time advances and actions occur"},"entryFee()":{"notice":"Entry fee each player must pay to join"},"maxPlayers()":{"notice":"Maximum number of players allowed in a single game"},"minPlayers()":{"notice":"Minimum number of players required to start the game (must be \u2265 3)"},"minPlayersReachedTime()":{"notice":"Timestamp (in seconds since epoch) when minPlayers was first reached (used to schedule phases)"},"pendingWithdrawals(address)":{"notice":"Mapping of addresses to their withdrawable ETH balances"},"playerAddresses(uint256)":{"notice":"Array of all player addresses who have joined (for enumeration)"},"players(address)":{"notice":"Mapping from player address to their Player struct"},"prizePool()":{"notice":"Total ETH in the prize pool (accumulates entry fees)"},"revealDuration()":{"notice":"Duration (in seconds) of the reveal phase (players reveal their guesses)"},"serviceFeePercent()":{"notice":"Platform service fee percentage (must be \u2264 20). Winner receives (100 - serviceFeePercent)% of pot."},"twoThirdsAverage()":{"notice":"Final 2/3\u2010average computed as floor((average * 2) / 3)"},"winner()":{"notice":"Address of the winner (closest guess to twoThirdsAverage)"}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"contracts/TwoThirdsAverageGame.sol":"TwoThirdsAverageGame"},"evmVersion":"paris","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":100},"remappings":[],"viaIR":true},"sources":{"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xff6d0bb2e285473e5311d9d3caacb525ae3538a80758c10649a4d61029b017bb","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8ed324d3920bb545059d66ab97d43e43ee85fd3bd52e03e401f020afb0b120f6","dweb:/ipfs/QmfEckWLmZkDDcoWrkEvMWhms66xwTLff9DDhegYpvHo1a"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x493033a8d1b176a037b2cc6a04dad01a5c157722049bbecf632ca876224dd4b2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6a708e8a5bdb1011c2c381c9a5cfd8a9a956d7d0a9dc1bd8bcdaf52f76ef2f12","dweb:/ipfs/Qmax9WHBnVsZP46ZxEMNRQpLQnrdE4dK8LehML1Py8FowF"]},"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol":{"keccak256":"0x11a5a79827df29e915a12740caf62fe21ebe27c08c9ae3e09abe9ee3ba3866d3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3cf0c69ab827e3251db9ee6a50647d62c90ba580a4d7bbff21f2bea39e7b2f4a","dweb:/ipfs/QmZiKwtKU1SBX4RGfQtY7PZfiapbbu6SZ9vizGQD9UHjRA"]},"contracts/TwoThirdsAverageGame.sol":{"keccak256":"0x53a2bd4f24e1bfd8a791add80d39f9bfe0537a24d51b22cc80480c2a582aa336","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://99160d7398d0ca12e1262a11d1ec76bb9a8fa2e149d80cfea4c3c08e6bc40c20","dweb:/ipfs/QmSX7uGdNLzdeJRnkQMUesbBiRkCk84oDQfiPc2G4Ff34H"]}},"version":1}
